arm_group.description: The intervention cohort will participate in an online team-based game on diabetes self-management education (DSME) and will receive a paper documents on American history,
The 'attention control' cohort will participate in an online team-based game on American history and will receive a paper documents on DSME.

brief_summary.textblock:
Investigators are conducting a randomized controlled trial to determine whether an online
      team-based spaced education (SE) game can improve HbA1c levels among these patients with
      diabetes (primary aim).  Secondary aims include determining the impact of the game on
      patients' pill possession ratio (PPR) of oral DM meds and their microalbumin/creatinine
      (M/C) ratio, ACE PPR, and ARB PPR.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interactive Spaced Education to Optimize Diabetes Care

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will be randomized to one of two cohorts: (1) the intervention cohort will
      participate in an online team-based game on diabetes self-management education (DSME) and
      will receive a paper documents on American history, and (2) the 'attention control' cohort
      will participate in an online team-based game on American history and will receive a paper
      documents on DSME.  Each game would consist of 2 questions per week x 25 weeks = 50
      questions total per arm.  The questions are delivered via email by the Qstream platform to
      the participants.  Upon clicking on a hyperlink in the email, participants select an answer
      that is downloaded to a server.  They are then provided with the answer to and explanation
      of the question, along with additional educational materials.  Using an adaptive
      methodology, the spacing and content of the game material will be individualized for each
      clinician based on their performance.   Home-based testing of HbA1c and M/C ratio will be
      conducted by patients at enrollment, 6 months and 12 months.  If successful, this SE game
      will improve diabetes management among VA patients and improve patient outcomes. Given the
      growing use of email and the Internet by patients, SE games could be easily expanded to a
      broad audience of VA patients with varying health problems across the country.  With content
      tailored to meet specific needs, SE games can be utilized as tools to improve patients'
      clinical outcomes by bolstering their health management behaviors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients in the northeastern Veterans Affairs hospital system who are taking oral
             diabetes medications, have a PPR<80%, and have a HbA1c >8.0.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

intervention.description: Investigators created an online educational game by incorporating game mechanics into an evidence-based form of online education, termed 'spaced education' (SE).  Based upon two psychology research findings (the spacing and testing effects), SE has been shown in randomized trials to improves knowledge acquisition, boosts learning retention for up to two years, and durably improves clinical behavior. SE is delivered using periodic emails that contain clinical case scenarios with multiple-choice questions.  Upon submitting an answer, the participant is presented with the correct answer and an explanation of the topic.  The material is then re-presented in a cycled pattern to reinforce the content.  Investigators introduced several game mechanics to turn SE into a game, including competition among participants, adaptive content reinforcement based on performance, and a progression dynamic (progress is displayed and measured by completing itemized tasks).

clinical_study.official_title: Interactive Spaced Education to Optimize Diabetes Care

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pill possession ratios of oral diabetes medications.
Treatment with angiotensin receptor blockers (ARB drugs) and angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors (ACE inhibitors).
Pill possession ratios of angiotensin receptor blockers (ARB drugs) and angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors (ACE inhibitors).
Low-density lipoprotein (LDL), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), total cholesterol & triglyceride levels,
Initiation or alteration of insulin therapy
Changes in oral diabetes medication regimen.
Patient-perceived empowerment to manage their diabetes.
Baseline knowledge levels of patients assessed via their initial responses to SE game questions -- DSME SE game cohort only.
Analysis of SE game performance differences by patient-related variables (age, gender, geographic location, baseline HbA1c, etc.) -- DSME SE game cohort only.
Patient-perceived acceptability of SE game interventions.
Patient-perceived barriers and facilitators to the SE game intervention.
Patient's perceptions of the optimal parameters for the SE game intervention.

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
